org.jlinalg.polynomial
Class PolynomialFactory<BASE extends IRingElement<BASE>>

java.lang.Object
  org.jlinalg.RingElementFactory<Polynomial<BASE>>
      org.jlinalg.polynomial.PolynomialFactory<BASE>
Type Parameters:
BASE - the type for the elements in the polynomial
All Implemented Interfaces:
IRingElementFactory<Polynomial<BASE>>
public class PolynomialFactory<BASE extends IRingElement<BASE>>
extends RingElementFactory<Polynomial<BASE>>

The factory for polynomials. The factory has to be created for a particular sub-type of IRingElement, that is the constructors of single elements have to be provided with a factory of this type.

Note: if the factory of the base type is not a singelton factory, it must implement java.lang.Object.equal(Object o) such that if the base type are considered equal, the factories are equal.

Author:
Georg THimm

getFactory

public static <RE extends IRingElement<RE>> PolynomialFactory<RE> getFactory(IRingElementFactory<RE> baseFactory)
obtain a factory for a given base type. This function can be called again for the same base type, but only one factory will be created @see PolynomialFactoryMap

Type Parameters:
RE - the base type for the factory
Parameters:
baseFactory -
Returns:
a factory for polynomials.

gaussianRandomValue

@Deprecated
public Polynomial<BASE> gaussianRandomValue()
Deprecated. 

Description copied from interface: IRingElementFactory
Returns a random value RE with distribution N(0, 1)
Note! Normal Distribution Issue
For the following RingElement types this method won't achieve the correct distribution: F2, FieldP

Returns:
random value RE
Throws:
InvalidOperationException - if called.
